text: The ability of PMA and HK E . coli to induce an inflammatory response in Jurkat T-cells was evaluated using a multiplex cytokine assay following 24 h stimulation .

The cytokine profile revealed an enhanced induction of the pro-inflammatory cytokines <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , TNF and the chemokine <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: The levels of the anti-inflammatory cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were unaffected by PMA but were significantly decreased by HK E . coli ( Table 1 ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Regulation unaffected <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IL-10 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation decreased <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IL-10 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: These results confirmed that PMA and HK E . coli induced an inflammatory response in the Jurkat T-cells .
It is interesting to note that PMA was 120-fold more effective at inducing <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> than HK E . coli .

text: PMA - dependent induction of AP-1 and down-regulation of NF-kappaB suggests an involvement of AP-1 in <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulation .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Regulation involvement <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme regulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Regulation regulation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme CXCL8 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Determination of the time course of cytokine induction in response to PMA showed that <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was already released between 2-6 h , while TNF and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were released between 6-24 h ( figure 3 ) .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Localization released <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme CXCL8 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Localization released <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IL-6 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: These results indicated that the cytokines were differentially regulated and that the release was not associated with the early transient induction of NF-kappaB .
The temporal induction of AP-1 correlated to the <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels and preceded the TNF and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release .
This suggests an association between <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release and AP-1 signalling .
